Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Savvas C
Reviews.Content: It was exactly what we expected to be. A clean new hotel, near to Sol square, and the cheapest among others in this area. It was a 5 minute walk to Sol square, which is the centre of town. You can go for shopping, sightseeing or going out at night by feet!

Reviews.Title: “a clean, cheap central hotel”
Reviews.Author: colm173
Reviews.Content: a clean, cheap centrally located hotel. just 5 minutes from sol square and the metro system. a short metro journey will bring you to Atocha were the Reine Sofia, Caixa Forum and the Prado museums. The hotel rooms are simple, air-conditioned and clean with very good showers.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: Javier P
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located in downtown. You would hardly need to take a metro because many of the main museums and places of interest are nearby. Rooms are spatious and look recently renewed. Being a very light sleeper I have to say this is one of the most quiet hotelsnI ve ever been. We had an interior room on the fifth floor. The staff was very friendly. I really like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_The_World3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is small, but it has a wonderful location. You can walk to the Sofia, Prado, and Thyssen in 15 minutes; to the Palace in 20 minutes; to Plaza Mayor in 5 minutes; to Puerto del Sol in 10 minutes. The Sunday Market (El Rastro) is two blocks from the hotel. A Metro/Tube stop is 1 block from the hotel (just down the street on the corner). There is a movie theatre and several restaurants just across the street. The hotel shares a corner building with the Hagen-Das Theatre. Just across the street are several shops, cafes, an outdoor market, souvenier shops, and the pathway to Plaza Santa Ana (many outdoor cafes/restaurants there). The rooms have interior and exterior locations. The rooms over the street can be a bit noisy in the evenings on Fridays and weekends, as people pouring out of the clubs/restaurants are headed out...and then later headed home. I was on the 4th floor and I could hear the street noise, but it didn't really bother me. I still slept with the window open. i would avoid any interior rooms that have walls that back-up to the Hagen-Das Theater on the other side. When the theatre puts on a production (usually music) you can hear every note through the walls and even feel the walls shaking. The room was nice and kept clean. It has a closet, mini-fridge, tv, 2 single beds, nightstand. The room has air conditioning and a small foyer. The bathroom is separate. Toiletries are provided (not the norm in many Spanish hotels). The shower head can be a bit awkward in some rooms...as it isn't in the usual spot at the "end" of the tub. In some rooms it is located in the middle of the wall. Imagine standing in the center of your tub and facing the wall. Strange, but you'll get used to it. If you get the breakfast package, you'll get a full breakfast with your room. The breakfasts are wonderful: eggs, bacon/ham, fruit, juice, coffee/tea, several pastries to choose from, potatos, and many other items to choose from. It's a good and full breakfast to start your day. There is a solarium on the roof if you feel the need to get some sun or need a quiet place to relax and read a book. The breakfast room has a large sitting area (separate room attached). There are some couches and chairs and a large screen tv. There are three computer terminals in the room with internet access. The hotel provides free wifi in the rooms and public areas. You can tell in the evenings when everyone is back in the hotel, the wifi slows down a bit. Overall, it is fast enough to let you get your work done. If you are there for business, you will not have a photcopier and you'll have to ask the front desk if they can print documents for you. No fitness center and no pool. The cleaning and front desk staff were INCREDIBLY friendly and helpful. This is a great hotel for the price and has a wonderful location.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Cooper826
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with fantastic views from the roof. The staff was very helpful with us, they have no problem to explain us things to do in the city. Great location, walking distance to everywhere but the rooms were smaller than we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location for exploring central Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Rich_J_E_H
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel on a trip with a big group of friends, all in our 30s. It was really well positioned near a number of the famous squares and so is really suitable for days/nights exploring the city. The hotel itself is well maintained and well run. Our room was clean, well furnished with good facilities (including good air conditioning!). The public areas in the hotel were modern and well kept. There is a small roof terrace with amazing views of Madrid - an ideal place to take a drink up to to admire the skyline. As it is a central hotel - be prepared for some street noise. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to be part of one of Madrid's most vibrant areas.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: Prettyinpink2008
Reviews.Content: In February this year my hubby and I spent 4 days in Madrid. I chose the Medium Cortezo for location. It is very central for shopping and night life. The hotel was very modern and clean. Breakfast was lovely, good choice and not crowded. We spent each day sightseeing and shopping and in the evening we ate at San Miguel Market. It is a must see and every taste was catered for. The free wi-fi was a great bonous. We seemed to miss the bar as we returned late each evening . We enjoyed our stay and intend to return next February.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free wifi”
Reviews.Author: MJakobson
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a few days' stay in central Madrid. The reason why we chose this one over several other similar hotels with similar pricing in the area, was free internet available throughout the hotel. Additionally, it is very conveniently located - easy walking distance from the royal palace as well as the art museums (Prado, Thyssen, Reina Sofia), and very close to the plaza mayor. The metro station Tirso de Molina is just a 100 m or so. Upon arrival we were pleasantly surprised by a free upgrade to the junior sweet. The room was nice, it had a large bathroom with a massage bath (but unfortunately the massage function was not working), a nicely decorated bedroom and a separate seating area. The windows toward the light well didn't offer a view, but it was nice and quiet in a city that never sleeps. The hotel looked as if it had been quite recently refurbished. The only negative aspect (which is common in most places in Madrid) was that although we requested a non-smoking room in our booking, the carpets, sofa etc in the seating area smelled of cigaret smoke. So if you're really sensitive toward this kind of issues I suggest you contact the staff and draw their attention to your preferences. We didn't, because the junior sweet was simply so cool. :) The staff was very helpful throughout the stay. There is also a possibility to store your luggage in the reception if you wish after you've checked out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location and free upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: David H
Reviews.Content: In July 2009 we stayed at this hotel while, they were renovating the hotel. The first room were kind of mediocre and poor maintained. About half way into our fortnight stay, we were upgraded to a brand new room. The rooms were large(larger than many 5-star european hotels), modern design decoration and huge bathroom. It is an advantage, to get a room facing the inner court since, we experienced quite a lot noise from the street. The staff were friendly and spoke good english. The breakfast was good for a 3 -star hotel, and there were a TV-lounge, and small computer area which we also enjoyed. Overall, you won't regret booking this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Tincrystal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during a Christmas trip and found the hotel most agreeable. The rooms were nicely decorated and spacious with the usual amenities. The bathroom was in urgent need of a make over but it was clean and served its purpose. Our twin beds were on castors which made for some interesting slumber as they would career wildly across the wooden floor when you turned over in your sleep but we found this amusing rather than a hindrance. Breakfast was excellent with a vast choice of hot and cold options and the dining room was a pleasant setting. Staff were friendly and helpful, booking excursions and advising on places of interest. The location of the hotel is excellent, with a number of bars and restaurants nearby. Transport links are good too meaning you can get around the city with ease although most major attractions are no more than a twenty minute walk from the hotel. I would heartily recommend this hotel and would not hesitate staying here again. I would also advise viewing some tabletop flamenco which is absolutely superb and not at all like my imaginings of men in frilly shirts stamping their feet and clapping their hands.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable peace in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: fran_beca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Medium Cortezo in September of 2011. We were weary from our long 18 hour flight. The hotel clerk was kind, understanding and very fast and efficient as she could see our state of affairs. We were assigned a room in short order. She was bilingual - Spanish and English - so when my Spanish vocabulary was lacking, she readily understood me. The room had marble flooring and a large bathroomm with tub which was very clean and equipt with towliing and an array of soaps. We had a room at the very end of the second floor hallway which made it very quiet. The window was open when we arrived and there was a nice breeze in the very temperature comfortable room. My companion and I took no time to get to sleep in their comfy beds. We awoke a few hours later, refreshed. There was good pressure and plenty of hot water in the nice bathroom for our showers. There is a bank of free computers for wifi downstairs from our room near the dining facility. I had purchased a yogurt from a store and asked for a spoon which was graciously given even though it was not time to dine yet. (It was about 3pm). Before embarking on our explore Madrid walk, we got a map and good information from the desk clerk. She asked if there was anything we needed in our room. This hotel entrance is not on a busy street, more like an alleyway. It was only 1 block to a bustle of activity of all the shops. There were many streets with really interesting shops with a variety of wares and a real abundance of restuarants of all ethnicities. We chose an east Indian restaurant which was very different but quite good. We walked to a square with a fountain that the locals seemed to be hanging out in. We continued past the fountain to a long promanade of streets which had trianguar shades at the roofs of the buildings which added shade and color. It was really interesting way to shade the walk. After walking until about 11pm, we found our way back to the hotel and got a very restful sleep. In the morning, checkout was very efficient and we were called a cab and went to the train station so we could continue our trip to Burgos. From there we started walking the Camino de Santiago, a glorious journey. I truly recommend the otel Medium Cortezo. It is all that one needs at an affordable price and near all the bustle of activity of Madrid. I know it will be revisited by me if I ever return to Madrid again - 4 stars for location, price, customer service and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Halal Restaurant & Train Station nearby”
Reviews.Author: szmeow
Reviews.Content: A very convenient place to stay, nearby train station, many cafes and there is an Indian shop selling Halal Maggie Noodles. We stayed three nights but was out most of the day. We went to Toledo and Segovia. Rooms are small but clean and modern. If you are small size it is ok. We like the free Wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable choice”
Reviews.Author: martan33
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a very good location, walking distance of only few minutes from the station, restaurants, Plaza Mayor and St. Miguel Market, where you must try tasteful tapas with a glass of quality wine. Hotel staff was very kind. Regarding the room- we booked junior suite so we were satisfied with everything- room and bathroom were very clean and big enough. Window was without a view, but it realy did not matter, because we spent most of the days outside and we were putting more attention to the size of the room and comfort. We would recommend this hotel to anybody who is looking for a decent and not expensive stay in Madrid, near all major points and near station wich enables you to move around easily. If you have time go and visit Toledo, it is worth visting it.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, great location”
Reviews.Author: whizbabe
Reviews.Content: Since it was our first time in Spain, my husband and I opted to stay at a hotel close to Plaza Mayor. The hotel is about 5 minutes away on foot from the Plaza. We stayed for 3 nights and always found the hotel staff cooperative and cheerful. Breakfast was included in the price of our room and it was great value. Fresh zumo, eggs, cold cuts, manchego cheese, churros and other baked goods were part of the fare. The only downside was the relatively small size of the room and the shower which lacked adequate water pressure.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculously tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Corrado76
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself is pretty good, excellent location, nice staff, clean rooms, nice furniture... problem is our room was so tiny we could not move inside it. There was a table right in front of the closet, so every time we needed to open the closet we had to move the table back and forth.same thing for the only chair present in the room: to be able to go to bed we had to move it in front of the room door and then to go out we had to move it back to the side of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location but too expensive for this quality”
Reviews.Author: mandrew1
Reviews.Content: We just returned back from Medium Cortezo and my feelings are mixed. I selected this hotel after checking many options in Madrid for a weekend escape. After the first night we changed our room because we heared the noise of a neighbouring disco where the party was finished at 4 pm. The next room was quiet and double size of the previous one but very dark. Anyways Madrid is beautiful city where i could spend a month at least!

Reviews.Title: “ADEQUATE”
Reviews.Author: Kiorawaikato
Reviews.Content: We booked our three day stay over the internet from NZ. No problems were encountered. The location of the hotel was close to the main tourist attractions such as the Market, the Cathedral and the tourist bus route. The outside appearance of the hotel was neat and tidy. The reception area was likewise spik and span. The room we were allocated was adequate and was clean although the grout between the bathroom tiles was black. The temperature control was not working or was it I needed a 10 year old to show me how it worked. A real negative was that there were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. I like to make my own cuppa first thing in the morning and last thing at night. The dinning room closed at 1500hrs on two of the days we were there. So we couldn't even get a drink there. The slamming of doors late at night was really a sleep disturber. The plastic mattress cover was noisy enough to wake you up if you turned over during the night. The receptionists were adequate with out having the wow factor. If wanting a taxi to the airport order your own. You will save 10 euro. The actual fare on the taxi meter was 20 euro but we were charged 30 euro. I assume the hotel charged the extra 10 euro for their booking fee. Would I stay at the Hotel again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to visit the city”
Reviews.Author: teodamia
Reviews.Content: The only problem in the room is that there is no window in the toilet. Unfortunately while I was there the kitchen was closed and I did not understand why...we had to go out for dinner

Reviews.Title: “Decent, Not Great”
Reviews.Author: mlenio11
Reviews.Content: From the photos, I thought the hotel was going to be great... It was only decent. Yes, the hotel location is very convenient to the downtown Madrid area. However, their building is shared with a theater / night club. We couldn't fall asleep until about 5am because the music was so loud and our walls were literally vibrating. The bathrooms are small and the photos you'll likely see online are probably their suites... Not their standard rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: banks_10
Reviews.Content: Great location,clean and tidy hotel,staff were very helpful and friendly,i was on floor 1 at the back so it wasn't very noisy,only slight complaint was the walls were very thin and my neighbours next door liked to talk alot at 2am,i'd advise going to the Bernabeu stadium,that was fantastic plus there is some great places to eat near to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Gaetan1
Reviews.Content: Very noisy at night with bars and cinema crouds in the street below. 10 euro breakfast is just OK, however you can only look at the fruit basket as it is for decoration.... Hard to believe but true. Fruits for breakfast are " canned"!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and affordable”
Reviews.Author: idelgado
Reviews.Content: I was surprised how nicely located this hotel is. It is true that it can get loud at night and the beds are not the most comfortable but the rooms are clean, modern and very decent. It was not overpriced and the service was excellent. I can recommend it to anyone that wants to spend a weekend in Madrid. Less than 5 minutes walk to Puerta del Sol and free wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, however poor sleeping.”
Reviews.Author: marc-goddyn
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the nice recent reviews by other customers. I followed the advice to ask for a room in the back of the building. Our room was quiet but the airco was so noisy that we tried to cool down with the window open. However there was also engine noise probably from the central airco. There was no fresh air because of the fact that the back of the hotel is closed on top. That made us feel a bit claustrophobic. The positive points of this 3 starred hotel are : the central location that allowed us to visit the main attractions by foot, and the breakfast buffet was OK although badly managed (only two personnel for too many guests).

Reviews.Title: “Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A_BennettFlitwick
Reviews.Content: Medium Cortez Hotel was perfectly located to be able to reach all the central attractions in Madrid easily on foot,only a short walk from the Metro station Tirse de Molina, and just less than 5 minutes to the Playa Mayor, and from there you can get almost anywhere, Cathedral, Palace, Tapas Market, Casa Baja, Puerto del Sol etc. The Madrid Teatro is at the end of the road (50m) and there is an international cinema opposite. on the way to the Playa Mayor there is a large church which is absolutely beautiful inside, the outside was shrouded in scaffolding as it was being renovated.The Hotel was very plain from the outside but actually friendly and welcoming inside. very Helpful staff, good size modern rooms. The breakfast room was small but pleasant and plenty of choice in the mornings, we had no trouble sitting with our friends or eating too much. Recommend joining the walking tours by New Europe (look online) we did the Tapas Experience €14 each for an evening tour taking in 3 tapas restaurants with a drink and food in each one about 3 hours. Also the City tour the next day scheduled for 3.5 hours took about 4.5 hours, this one is basically free but the guides work on tips only so they work really hard and you get a lot out of it. After that you pretty much know your way around the centre of Madrid. Try the Madrono Licor drink in El Madrono it comes in chocolate coated edible shot glasses, also be aware that the Sangria comes in pints in a lot of places, and Puerto Del Sol is ,manic (in a nice way) when the shops close in the evenings Biggest issues to be aware of were teams of pickpockets working on the Metro system and some busier areas of the City, and beggars, I don't mind supporting the homeless and the destitute, but most of these did not look hungry or short of anything, it was hard to distinguish between the genuinely needy and the professionals.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: nycsarah
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I stayed here for a long girls' weekend in Madrid. This hotel is located close to two Metro stops and easily accessible. Our room was larger than expected - three twin beds, but a desk and a closet as well. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Friendly, accommodating staff and nice surroundings were the 2 main features of this hotel. The hotel is very near the Tirso de Molina metro stop on the line which cuts through central Madrid. Situated in a surprisingly quiet street (bearing in mind there are theatres and a cinema in it), it was easy to access Puerta del Sol and the rest of the city centre. The room I had was quite large with a good bathroom but, to be really picky, the light in the corridor outside my room blinked on and off all night. There seemed to be some sort of malfunction in its sensor. After mentioning it to the receptionist, they promised to repair it soon. Other than that, everything was good and I'd recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Spain in need of a good place to sleep without breaking the bank!.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: etatsunis
Reviews.Content: Medium Cortezo has a central location in Madrid, allowing walking to many central city sights. Its decor is very modern, which is somewhat offputting but comfortable, nonetheless. Excellent buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: EgyptAndSummer
Reviews.Content: on the day of arrival, a small change of the room because we didn't have our double bed as requested, a few hours later this was settled. breakfast was alright. Service was good, the room was cleaned every day.. the bed could be better, the door was loud when you closed it. the street where the hotel was situated was a little grim. but the neighbourhood was good, a lot of restaurants, shops etc..

Reviews.Title: “Only one problem at the Cortezo.”
Reviews.Author: Mick&Janet
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in mid November, having picked it primarily for its location. The staff on reception were friendly and proffesional, quick to return our smiles and giving us a nice room just up one flight of stairs. The rooms on this landing had a double set of glazing on each window. I assume this was to cover any street noise earlier reviewers had highlighted. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was huge and very clean. We ate a very good breakfast at the hotel every day. The pastrys were plentiful - also fruit, and bacon and eggs. If you come here and want to go to Le Rastro its only 5 mins walk away. I would consider returning here. Its so central. The only incident which might put me off would be the shouting which woke us on our last morning at 08:00. I think some businessmen had booked the room next door for a meeting and forgot they were in a hotel

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: JayJ1
Reviews.Content: Having read some mixed reviews, I decided to ignore the really bad ones as, in my past experience, the people who rate hotels at one star are usually well in the minority and seem to be basing the whole review on one particular gripe. I'm glad I did as, although the hotel is far from perfect, it is everything I would expect at the rates for a well located hotel in a major city. What do I mean by far from perfect? Nothing drastic, but important points nonetheless. The room was reasonably, but not excatly huge. Again, that's all I'd expect at the price. Also, there are no safes in the rooms, so valuable have to be left in safety deposit boxes beside reception. Fine for keeping money, passports etc, but no good for leaving cameras and other bulky items when going out at night. It's also a pain having to go to reception every time you want money our of the box. So, nothing drastic as I said before. The positives? For me there were plenty. Firstly, the hotel is less than 5 minutes walk from Plaza Mayor and is within easy walking distance of the Cathedral and the Royal Palace and is only about 15-20 minutes walk from the major museums and Parque Retiro. Also about 15 minutes walk away is Atoch Railway station, should you wish to venture further afield. We booked to go on a Tapas and Wine tour which meets at Plaza de la Villa and that was only two minutes further on from Plaza Mayor. Also in that close vicinity are Mercado de San Miguel and the worlds oldest restaurant, (according to the Guinness Book of Records), Sobrino de Botin. Other than location, the main pluses were the staff, (friendly and helpful, without gushing over you), and, as I said before, the price. I paid 400 Euros for five nights there and have paid more for lower quality hotels in far less central locations. So, all-in-all, I'd say it would be a good choice for anyone who doesn't expect five-star quality for three-star prices. Those are the people who would give it one star, but I gave it four. Lastly, on the subject of poor reviews, ignore what you read about Botin. I decided to take a gamble on it in spite of many lees than favourable reviews, and only did that because of the chance to eat somewhere so famous within five minutes walk from my hotel. My wife and I both thought it was excellent and I'll write a separate review for that in the appropriate section.

Reviews.Title: “Location is great but noisy at night.....”
Reviews.Author: CairnsAussie52
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night before flight out next day and had the worst night sleep ever with room over looking street. The street noise during the night and early hours of morning until 5am was constant, and the double glazed windows were closed. Otherwise the room was clean and tidy but bed was not so comfortable. Breakfast was reasonable. Major Plaza only a short walk from Hotel. WiFi was free with own laptop.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & breakfast, good price”
Reviews.Author: Waterfall84
Reviews.Content: Been to this hotel because of the price. Good price in central Madrid. Was a bit scared about the quality, but the hotel (being a 3-star) exceeded my expectations. Building is uninspiring but common areas (i.e. breakfast room, corridors) are new and very well kept. Breakfast is excellent for a 3-star hotel. Room is OK, mine faced street but I saw in the floor plan that most rooms faced tiny courtyards... beware of that. Just the bathroom was a bit old.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne005
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and comfortable. Location was good. Staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great location + breakfast + room ~”
Reviews.Author: Uta088
Reviews.Content: we had stayed there for 6 nites in the last week of July ~ The room and bathroom are quite big and comfortable, the breakfast is great which makes a day energetic ~ It takes only 5 minutes walk to the shopping area and there's supermarket nearby ~ The free wi-fi access is definitely a plus. The hotel is trendy ! I would stay there again next time when I go to Madrid ~

Reviews.Title: “A very nice budget hotel overall - quite satisfied!”
Reviews.Author: Evgeny2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really in the center of Madrid and within walking distance to just everything. We only used the metro once in two days in Madrid because the kid was tired. The hotel has the parking (you may need to pay extra for it, we did not need it), the room had the minibar, tv, wi-fi access. The staff was very friendly. Not much more to say, we had quite a pleasant stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Sharp, clean, perfectly located, and affordably priced”
Reviews.Author: drdougd
Reviews.Content: I led a group of 13 to do humanitarian work in Eastern Europe and we returned through Madrid for a couple of days of relaxation. We stayed at Hotel Medium Cortezo. We had a great experience there. The hotel is not a large or extremely fancy hotel (the marble floors were pretty sharp and the two elevators were sufficient), but it was extremely nice and very clean, with spacious rooms by European standards. It was in an excellent location, just a 3 or 4 minute walk from Puerte del Sol and Plaza Mayor. A Metro subway stop is located just a block south of the hotel and there is a major Metro stop at Puerte del Sol. Restaurants, small groceries, and shops of various kinds abound in the immediate area. The air conditioning worked well in our rooms and the free wifi was a plus. The breakfast buffet was very good and fresh, including boiled and scrambled eggs, bacon, various fruits, meats and cheeses, bread and pastries, cereal, and coffee and juice. There is no restaurant for the other meals, but it is unnecessary since you'll want to try out the restaurants in the area anyway. The rooftop solarium includes a beautiful view of the surrounding area and some lawnchairs and a couple of showers if you'd like to work on your tan while you are there. An exercize room would have been nice. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. They spoke adequate English, though some spoke it a little better than others. Patricia Willems of the office staff made every effort to help us have just what we needed when we arrived. She adjusted our rooms for us just before our arrival and made the extra effort to warn us of the Metro strike that would have made our use of the metro to get to the hotel on our evening of arrival impossible. She made minibus transfer arrangements for us (about 20 minutes from the airport by bus) and made sure that everything was perfect. She even initiated contact after the trip to make sure all went well. If you're looking for an authentic European hotel in Madrid that is sharp, clean, perfectly located and affordably priced (and not a major brand, luxury hotel), I don't know how you could do better than Medium Cortezo.

Reviews.Title: “perfect choice for short weekend stay in madrid”
Reviews.Author: atleticodeglasgow
Reviews.Content: We travelled here as a a group of 10 guys,with the main purpose of seeing football match with a bit of sightseeing and food and drink thrown in for good measure.The hotel was perfect. In fairness we weren't in our rooms much,we stayed in 203 (not the 10 of us!),but they were clean with an efficient maid service.There was a mini bar with relatively reasonable prices.The rooms were smallish,but when on a city break,you ain't really in them that much.There was a bit of noise from out front.but that is the trade off for an excellent central location.a few of the guys stayed in the back and thought it was a wee bit quieter.there was a bit of sound from other rooms,but nothing drastic.the beds were not the biggish,but very comfortable. The staff were very polite and efficient at reception and helped me in english when my attempts at spanish were stumbling. the breakfast was good value at 8 euros if booked in advance.the two staff worked like trojans,and were kept busy. a few times one of the ten of us would need something that wasn't available,but a polite question got it promptly. we booked with the medium group directly,and got a great deal.i would recommend trying them once you have searched about.they beat any offer i could find,and for five rooms i thought that was great.Roberto, at reservations help, was prompt and invaluable.i would certainly stay here again,if with a group of friends or partner for this kind of weekend.If with kids,would go down the apartment route,though. Location was perfect (easy walking distance ) for sol,plaza mayor,palace,mercado san miguel,plaza santa ana and just yards from metro.hotel mentions sol station,but tirso de molina is closer.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: sweetasyourdreams
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night and it's a lovely hotel down a quiet lane away from the noise and traffic. Yes, there's renovation work being done to the outside of the hotel but this didn't start at a ridiculous hour and it has to be done! The room was spotlessly clean and very central, opposite Sol. Free wifi, which worked, unlike some other hotels! Reception was efficient and friendly. Always book online in Spain because it's cheaper, even last minute. I wasn't bothered by any bad characters outside the hotel. In Madrid, you have to be very careful with your belongings, as it's a big city like any other big city and you will be robbed if your guard is down!. Take the hop on hop off tourist bus to see the city. If you get a bargain price, definitely don't turn this hotel down, just don't pay full price until the building work is finished!

Reviews.Title: “It will be even better!”
Reviews.Author: beepee
Reviews.Content: The hotel was booked for us by a Barcelona-based travel agent. We got a taxi from the airport and it cost us €40 - there are other options as other reviewers have pointed out. We were given two rooms on E - entrasuelo floor. the same as the bar, lounge and breakfast room. One was a suite which was large and well furnished. Very clean, very comfortable with very efficient air con (vital in last week's heat!). We had breakfast on our first morning - an extra €5 each. Worth every penny. Very happy apart from early morning alarm call from the builders outside! Things to note: This hotel is very well placed for the city but also well placed for the ladies of the night outside the nearby Haagen Dazs cafe! Room with 3 laptops in with free access to www.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful!”
Reviews.Author: Jan27piglet
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its location, which is excellent. Right in the middle of where you need to be, round the corner from Plaza Mayor, shops, resturants etc. I would recommend getting the metro from the airport it only cost 2 euro and its really easy! ask at the information desk and they will happily tell you where you need to go. The nearest Metro to the hotel is Sol. Right the hotel....when we arrived the hotel was under refurbishment so its a bit of a mess, we got put on the first floor and found a dirty room, bed unmade, towels on the floor, cigarettes and a really dirty bathroom. We went and complained and got put on the 4th floor which was a lovely surprise, we we're given a suite with a huge balcony. The tv's were fussy and didnt work well at all. I would certainly recommend to be asked to put on the 4th floor if you are visiting whilst the refurbishment is happening . The other floors we're very noisy during the day whilst the work was being carried out. I can really see the potential in this hotel once the work is complete, so if you can get a refurbished room then i would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “No issues really (if cheap)”
Reviews.Author: ritapaola
Reviews.Content: Firstly let me say that we made the mistake of booking this through a travel agent back home, which no doubt pushed the price up. It was fine but we were constantly thinking it was expensive for what we got. It is conveniently located near plenty of cafe's, restaurants, and a laundromat (which we really needed). Although the area seemed to get a bit dicey later in the evening. The floorboards in the room were a bit squeaky as well and I could the people next to us getting up in the middle of the night...Overall OK though if you can get it cheap.

Reviews.Title: “rubbish...”
Reviews.Author: OllyDollyDublin
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for our trip to Madrid on the basis that it was comfortable,modernised and that there would be a shuttle bus that took 10 mins to get you to the airpoirt and also that the local market was across the road.....None of the above was true.I would not recommend this kip in a million years.It was an old hotel that needed refurbishment, and the reception staff hould go on a customer care course.They were very rude.As for the market being close by....well it was'nt. There was no shuttle bus at all and the airport was a good 40 mins away in a speeding taxi, where they have no trouble in ripping you off especially if you don't speak spanish.My tip....Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: GKoonin
Reviews.Content: Brilliant central location. Slightly threadbare in parts but good value all round. Stayed in Room 202, some street noise but nothing extraordinary for a Friday night in Madrid (easily drowned out by earplugs). Breakfast is good value at EUR 8 for a selection of fruits, cereals, breads, cakes, pastries, eggs, bacon, sausage etc. Hotel does not have WiFi (contrary to what it says on Expedia), though I believe this is coming soon, but you can connect inroom via dial-up.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: VickyH
Reviews.Content: As always I read the reviews before booking-it came out ok and for 2nights it was a good option-i read the reviews again befoer going to MAdrid and they made it out to be better than it actually was so was disappointed! However the location IS Briliant-you could not want better-easy to walk to all the best sites and the best tapas and live music venues so that more than made up for the thin walls-yes they are thin, small rooms and stinky drains, no natural light and small bed-but it was ok for 2 nights! Breakfast was ok too-toast, juice, hot eggs, yogurts-more than enough. opposite was agreta cafe for Churros and Chocolate and within 2 mins walk the Cafe Central has great live music and ok food and Plaza ana has great Tapa bars. The metro was great as previous reviews say to get to and from airport-not as compliacted as sounds and took about 40mins-perfect at 2 Euros! Best sights for short trip-the Royal palace, Real Madrid football ground if a footie fan-Madrid vison good to go round and listen to history but can walk everything!Loved the park!

Reviews.Title: “friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: winterGraysEssex
Reviews.Content: we stayed in room 208 for a week in aug/sept. For a budget hotel this was more than adequate valuewise. The staff were very helpful and friendly, the room was clean and very quiet. except for the noisy air conditioning, we turned it off one night and nearly suffocated with the heat, so we had to put up with it. The breakfast though on a small scale was fine. The hotel is a bit threadbare in places and needs some money spent on it . We had a wonderful week in Madrid and the hotels location was perfect, we did'nt expect a luxury hotel, so we was'nt dissapointed. We would certainly be coming back to Madrid and we would'nt mind staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good central location”
Reviews.Author: koalas2
Reviews.Content: Just stayed 4 days in the Cotezo Hotel. The chepest way to get there from the airport is using the metro, you dont even have to leave the airport to catch it! There is a few stops & changes but once you have the right numbers its very easy & only cost 2 euros each, as apposed to around 25 euros in a taxi! The Hotel was clean & tidy & the staff were helpfull & not at all unfriendly as other revues said. We also never experienced much noise from other guests, maybe becuase it was midweek or late summer! Although i might add the maids were extremley noisy in a morning, slamming doors & cupboards. luckily for us we were up & getting ready to go out! Not an inconveniance if you dont want a lie in!! The room was fine & of a decent size with a fridge/mini bar ,hairdryer & everything that you need, (but tea/coffee making faccilities would of been nice) The location is great for bars, cafes & restaraunts in Puerta del Sol area, & only a short stroll to most other sight seeing places. The city bus tour- 'Madrid Vision' is a good start to see where you want to visit, also you can hop on & off as many times as you like! We booked this Hotel with 0800 Hotels website & found this the cheapest one after searching for a long time!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: joebow
Reviews.Content: We arrived with our two children. Thought it was a best western as advertised on website. First receptionist was very nice and attending to our requirements with having children. Got to our room and there was no hall light and had to find the key hole with the key. We arrived in our room which we found tired looking. Beds were uncomfortable with springs sticking out. Shower was crap and had a small window in bathroom which would not close. It looked out to a plank of wood and brick wall with a ladder going up. very dodgy. We went out for the day and returned later in the evening to find housekeeping (although very friendly) had left our hotel door open all day. We did have our stuff in the safe (which you have to pay one euro each time you use it) but it was the principal. The other reception staff were not that friendly and breakfast staff had no personality. We went for breakfast and sat down and they did not even set up a table. We had to go round collecting our cultery cups etc from work stations, whilst they were setting up tables around us that were unoccupied. On departure we booked a taxi with the hotel. we were aware that it was around 25 euros for the airport trip. It was around 3am. the taxi driver took us to the airport and i realised there was no meter and no license. She charged us 35 euros. Felt really ripped off. Do not normally complain but this experience left us really disappointed. We knew this was a budget hotel but this was not a good experience. We had just stayed at the travelodge in the suburbs for 20 euros a night and it was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantástico Hotel Medium Cortezo”
Reviews.Author: m_hodgey
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 102 on the second floor of the Hotel Medium Cortezo for 4 nights in July 2008 on a city break with friends and family. We arrived in Madrid by Metro from the airport mid-afternoon and were able to check-in straight away. The nearest Metro station to the hotel is only a five minutes walk away at ‘Tirso De Molina’. From the airport take Metro line 8 to ‘Nuevos Ministerios’, which is the terminus station for this line. Then take Metro line 10 (direction ‘Puerta Del Sur’) to ‘Tribunal’. Finally take line 1 (direction ‘Valdecarros’) to ‘Tirso De Molina’. The hotel’s central location is very good, with the city and all the main tourist sites within easy walking distance of the hotel. For sites further a field, Metro stations ‘Tirso de Molina’ and ‘Sol’, which are within close proximity of the hotel, provide easy connection with all parts of the city and beyond. There are a good selection of bars and restaurants within a close vicinity of the hotel. The room was very clean and tidy and the bed linen and towels were changed daily. The television in the room only consisted of Spanish channels, but there again I didn’t go to Madrid to watch TV so this didn’t bother me. The windows were all double-glazed so street noise at night was minimal. One very small complaint with the room was the fact that the room safe was coin operated and therefore cost 1 Euro every time you wanted to lock it. Breakfast was served on the first floor of the hotel and there was an ample choice of continental breakfast items to eat such as pastries, meats, salads, bread, juice, cereals and fresh fruit, plus cooked items such as sausages, bacon and scrambled egg. There was also a good selection of drinks including coffee, fruit juices and a variety of flavoured teas. Overall, a great value hotel, which is ideally located to explore the city. I would have no problems in staying at this hotel again if I visit Madrid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: EC2006
Reviews.Content: I'm just back after spending 4 nights in Hotel Cortezo and I must say it was very enjoyable. The hotel is very central to everything and anything that is too far to walk to you can get a metro from just down the street. What's great about this hotel is that you can pop in passing as it's so central so if you have bags etc to drop off it's not out of the way The hotel itself was fine, it could do with a few new carpets on the landings but all in all it was fine. Our room was small but the bathroom was a good size and very clean. Our towels were replaced every day and we got fresh linen also during the 4 days. The air con didn't work, well it made lots of noise but didn't do much but luckily we didn't need it all that much. The breakfast is perfect it caters for every taste and worth getting up for. The staff in the hotel are very nice and there is someone on reception 24hours. One thing we missed out on was the shuttle bus to the airport, we didn't know you had to book it 24 hours in advance so we got a metro instead. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone going on a city break it's not luxury but it's clean and very central at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only if you can't afford another place”
Reviews.Author: ReadyToGo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at TRH Cortezo. Although the room was a decent size, it had a terrible odor that never left--even though I was in a non-smoking room. The bath room ceiling had holes in it and was in much need of repair. Bring some incense or room freshner if you plan to stay here! The staff spoke some Enlgish, but maybe less comprehension then I anticipated since they made several errors on my requests, including a taxi for the airport . It arrived a day prior to my departure. After I thought I corrected the issue, there was no cab at the time of my actual departure. I was charged 40 Euro for a Taxi from the hotel to the airport. Sometimes there are charges for using the phone, even when you use your phone card. They are not posted, so you'll have to ask. The hotel was filled with American high school students on tour. A great place for them and the budget they are likely on. A hair dryer is included in the bathroom, but no shampoo, wash clothe, shower cap or coffee maker. On the positive side, the breakfast was great!!! Offer 7:30am-10:30am there was enough food options for anyone. The location of the hotel is very good, close to Sol Metro station, near restaurants and stores. Walking distance from the Royal Palace and Plaza Mayor. Day trips can be booked at the front desk but you'll have to pay in cash. I suggest going directly to Pullmantur and arranging with them where you can get the most information as well as pay with credit card. They are located a 15 minute walk away at Plaza Oriente 8, 28013 Madrid, Spain, tel: 915 411 066.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what you want it to !”
Reviews.Author: pami.eire
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Madrid in November , The hotel is in a fantastic location very central , rooms are fine and big and comfy and the staff are helpful . This hotel is cheap ,central , clean and comfortable and I would recommend to anyone . The only one thing I would say as a fault is it could do with some redecorating ie a lick of paint , new carpets etc etc but thats me just being fussy !!

Reviews.Title: “When thay Fixed the Aircondition?”
Reviews.Author: ORENHSELA
Reviews.Content: As other said, it is in the center, very neer Plaza Mayor and Poerto Del sol. rooms are small or very small Breakfast More then OK. Even the staff was OK +. The aircondition is like tracktor, lot of noise, but did nathing, big problem. we stayed from 11 to 13 Oct 07, Us and other copple. all other hotel in this travel to Spain (7 Hotels) was beter. none was bad.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe the internet”
Reviews.Author: Roxy1717
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, expedia said they had a free shuttle service to the airport, NO THEY DON"T. there is no such thing at their hotel. they had no idea what i was talking about, and that was the only reason i picked that hotel. the room had a horrible smell to it, almost like sewage, and the shower head was positioned on the long side of the tub, not on the end, so when you showered water went ALL over the bathroom. there was no alarm clock or no clock on the TV to set, so that you could wake up on time. Breakfast was not included, but you could pay over 10 euros if you wanted to have it, i decided not to. otherwise it was very centralized to everything in madrid. right across the street from the cinema, and a couple minutes from the metros. one to the north and one to the south. plaza del sol was a couple minutes away as well as some great indian food.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Malaga.Spain
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is ideal, very close to Sol and Gran Via. The staff is very helpful. Rooms are old fashion but vey clean and the air conditioning works very weel. The area isn´t very nice. The tube stops Tirso de Molina is only 20 mtrs away. If you are looking for a standard hotel to discover Madrid, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel of Two Halves!”
Reviews.Author: PuddleDuck_7
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for 3 nights at Easter and overall it was positive. The hotel is very central, literally 5 minutes into the main square. We didnt have to use the metro at all to get around the city in those few days so cost saving. However, for the good sides there are always bad - and that is the noise. Our room was situated right next to the night club. From 9.30pm We Will Rock You was on which we heard with great clarity until 12.30am. Then from about 1am until 6am (I checked the time after no sleep) the night club could be heard, This was not as clear but just the base vibrating. We did get used to it. The other solution would be to check where your room was - it is probably better further away from that end of the hotel. Nearly forgot to mention one morning after little sleep (musicals & night clubs) we then heard more noise at about 8.30am. Thinking this was probably party goers on their way home I looked out to see who had been keeping us awake. However, the samaritan church located opposite our room was giving out breakfasts to homeless people. This only happened one morning thankfully as it seems the rest of the Easter weekend they went hungry! In terms of the hotel it is clean, comfortable, we found the staff pleasant and the breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and lovely hotel for mini weekend”
Reviews.Author: sp_around_the_world
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Staff nice welcoming atmosphere, we stayed in triple room which was huge. Downside is a little noisy from the theatre - but if you like We will Rock you- then you are fine - excellent location and you have all the best places around you. Great hotel overall.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely noisy...”
Reviews.Author: RealGrayFox
Reviews.Content: Good place - close to center and metro station. Not bad breakfast, but... From 9 p.m. to... 1 or 2 a.m. You will hear LOUD music, - may be from musical theatre (in the same buiding), may be from discoteque. Room 212 - avoid it if You can! One more unpleasant thing - every morning about 100 homeless people waits for free breakfast in the church across the street (50 meters from entrans of hotel)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Ticket_to_ride525600
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Hotel TRH Cortezo while on a group tour, the rooms are smaller then the pictures suggest but i shared a room with three other girls and had no problems. The locations is fantastic, you can walk out side and have all of Madrid at your finger tips. The rooms were clean and in good condition and the breakfast included with the room cost was considerably better then many others i've had at different hotels. I also found the staff to be very helpful especially with my barely bumbling spanish. The one problem i saw was the elevator is a tad slow, but that wouldn't even dent my enthusiasim to stay at the Hotel TRH Cortezo.

Reviews.Title: “Small, smelly rooms and unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: william14_6Edegem
Reviews.Content: The rooms are much smaller than suggested in the pictures: one of them shows a junior suite! The room offered to us smelled like an ashtray, the non-smoker alternative room smelled like a sewer. The staff is very unfriendly, and hardly speaks English. The location of the hotel and breakfast are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: mariaShepperton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Cortezo for two nights in February 2006, with 2 children aged 8 and 10. The positives are: The hotel is very central. The breakfast, if it is included in the cost of your stay, is very good. The negatives: The staff are unfriendly, unhelpful and rude. The rooms are very basic and the beds small and uncomfortable. There was 4 us and only 3 beds and when I complained they bought another bed in!! There was very little natural light as there is one small window with no outlook. The room had a subtle scent of sewage!! I think there was a problem with the plumbing. The room is next to a theatre and you we could hear the musical full blast!! Myself and the 10 year old were wide awake until after midnight. Although my partner and the 8 year old managed to sleep through it all!! We managed to get a good deal on the booking through Airmiles which meant I could accept the negatives. But had I paid the going rate I would have been very very disappointed and would definitely not pay the going rate to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: JulieCLiverpool
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a three night stay at this very disappointing hotel. Room was very old fashioned, stained towels and bed spreads, tiled floor was marked, off-white walls in anyglypta wallpaper. Definately not the standards described on the Best Western website. Bathroom however was modern and clean although the shower was not a 'Hans Grohe' more of a 'no go'. I had booked a double room but was given a twin. When I went back down to the lobby to ask the receptionist about this, he was apologetic but said that the hotel only had five double rooms and that none were available. There were lots of renovation works going on which were very noisy and messy which were not mentioned when I booked the hotel. Breakfast was good and varied and the breakfast room itself was very pleasant. Staff were friendly although one night I went down to the lobby to see if I could get a juice and the receptionist was flat out unconscious on the sofa! HHmmmmmm...... Location was central within 5 mins walk of Sol and this was the main reason for booking the hotel. Unless the renovation work transforms the hotel into a palace, I definately would not stay there again!.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and value”
Reviews.Author: riskyman
Reviews.Content: I recently went to madrid and spent two days in this hotel. It has a perfect location, is clean, the rooms are comfortable, the service is good and I find a bargain price for booking with anticipation. Is a perfect hotel for those budget tourist that does not want to loose comfort. Perfect balance between price and quality. I would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: inkwave17
Reviews.Content: This was a really good hotel for a cost-conscious traveler who wants to be near everything. RIght in the middle of everything, walking distance to Plaza Mayor and even museums if you are a walker. Also directly across from a movie theater showing English language movies! Rooms were nice, very clean and very new bathrooms as others have mentioned. Unfortunately my bathroom had a slightly off smell, but I didn't spend a ton of time in there, so it was not too annoying. Overall a really good choice to stay while in Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and reasonable price would stay again and again did not want to l”
Reviews.Author: belizeLady
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Madrid, Spain on Aug 9, 2004 I stayed at this hotel for my trip, has the best location location, the very heart of everything, walking distance to whatever you can want or thing of, nightlife is exciting, staff is very helpfull with recommedations for events, please see Bullfights, and Flemenco show, but if you want a reasonable hotel that is very very clean, newly renovated, big rooms beautiful bathroom, clean clean clean, breafast contential and overall great felling of the meaning of an affordable vaction this is the place Hotel Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappoinment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 + week in Spain. Hotel Cortezo was our only disappointing hotel. We arrived on a Saturday night with the street filled with people, cars, motorcycles, on the first floor. At first, when I protested, they said they had nothing else, but finally found us a room in the back. While it was quieter than being on the street, we heard restaurant noises throughout the day and into the night. On the plus side, although very small, the room was clean with a nice bathroom. All other parts of the hotel were quite smokey. I would not stay there again.
